DOC.brief_summary: The aim of this randomized control study is to evaluate the effect of tonsillectomy with or without uvulopalatoplasty in treating adults with moderate to severe sleep apnea.
DOC.brief_title: Comparison Between UPPP and Tonsillectomy in Adult OSA
DOC.detailed_description: Patients are after baseline PSG 1 included and randomized to either UPPP or TE. They are stratified according to tonsil size, those with size 2 in one group and those with 3-4 in another. They all undergo surgery within two months and thereafter PSG 2 after 6 months and PSG after 4 years. At PSG they fill in questionnaires and measurements of blood pressure.
DOC.criteria: AHI more than 15 Friedmans stage I and II Tonsil size 2, 3 and 4 BMI below 34 Failed use of CPAP and dental device Severe cardiovascular or neurological disease Prefers strongly one surgical method ASA IV
